interesting_fact: China has a 13-hour-long single train ride called the 'Dragon Express' that covers over 2,200 km.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than people.
Brazil is the only country in South America where Portuguese is the official language.
India has the world's largest postal network, with over 150,000 post offices.
Russia spans 11 time zones, the most of any country in the world.
Japan has more vending machines per capita than any other country, with over 5 million machines.
Egypt is home to the world's oldest dress, estimated to be over 5,000 years old.
The United States has the most Olympic gold medals of any country.
Iceland is the only country in the world without mosquitoes.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria (administrative), Bloemfontein (judicial), and Cape Town (legislative).
